column4: hi, how do i configure glassfish on jaunty? it creates a default domain at /var/lib/glassfish/domains/domain1 which starts automatically using the root user
hi, how do i configure glassfish on jaunty? it creates a default domain at /var/lib/glassfish/domains/domain1 which starts automatically using the root user
hi, how do i configure glassfish on jaunty? it creates a default domain at /var/lib/glassfish/domains/domain1 which starts automatically using the root user. dpkg can't find the install.pl script
well, asadmin and all the other glassfish thingies still work by the book, so...
Its not really anything ubuntu specific...
but i can't configure the default installation. only my personal domains
You can configure the default installation as long as you are switching to the user it's configured for - but it IS more elegant to just have your own domains, yse
Better not use the default one, actaully.
but how can i stop it and make it never start up automatically?
aah. perhaps it's in /etc/init.d/glassfish?
or /etc/rcX.d/glassfish
ok, did not know about rcX.d directory
not in any of the rcX.d directories either there eit
not in any of the rcX.d directories either
and you did check /etc/init.d/glassfish?
yes, that script doesn't exist either
odd, it used to be started this way when installed by ubuntu
the package i installed is called "glassfishv2" and not the "glassfish-appserv"
i don't know how this one is started, then... do you run a command or something?
no, i just installed it through aptitude and it started by itself
Ubuntu would, by default, usually use these files / directories I pointed you at to run something on startup. But I'm not sure if you have even rebooted in the meantime?
I usually look for startup scripts in /etc/init.d. and no, I haven't rebooted since the installation, do you think it would help?
It is entirely possible that apt just started a glassfish server with a domain for you, once, and that this default domain doesn't get started automatically the next time anyways.
thanks for you support, i will try to reboot
